f6_assessments.q0:
The proposer wants to build an open-source, free to use CNFT-based food and drug traceability solution on the Cardano blockchain, available for both mobile and PCs.
The described solution is quite simple, the producer mints the NFT with the designed metadata included, that would offer all the necessary information on that specific product - there is a link provided that shows metadata for tea, with information about batch date, brand, taste information, harvesting data etc. With a web-based visualiser or a mobile app, the metadata can become more palatable to the average consumer, the coordinates can become a map, etc., as was also visible in the provided link.
The solution offered in the proposal is at a very low cost and can offer multiple applications for small farmers in developing nations as well as for pharmaceutical companies from said countries, that can start offering tracking and tracing of their products at a low cost, thus having a positive impact on not just the communities in need of this product, but on the Cardano ecosystem as well.
f6_assessments.q1:
The plan and timeline are a bit too generalised, and it would have helped to describe several other steps that are needed to implement the project: web app developing - how much time needed, mobile app developing - how much time needed etc.
The budget required is very low, but well broken down, considering the low amount asked, $2000 - though when all amounts are being added up they make $2200, so the proposer should consider this, if funding will be received.
There is unfortunately no team description, only a list of specialisations needed, but no other information regarding the proposer or the rest of his team. But in the summarised experience find, he mentioned he is blockchain researcher and web developer, and added another team member named P.C who is supposed to be website and mobile app developer.
Unfortunately, without any other type of information or social profiles provided, I cannot correctly assess their skills and capabilities in implementing the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2:
The metrics described in the development progress are feasible and realistic, and well related to the question. It would have been more helpful if the team could have provided some additional info regarding where this metrics could be evaluated independently by the community.
Success is too generalised, for a proposal voted by the community, it is very important to have clear defined milestones that the community can easily asess. For example: XX number of companies have used our service in the first xx months.
If not funded, I would highly suggest to the proposer to resubmit it in a future fund with the lacking information added and perhaps, with a modified budget, as well.
